artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Jōshūya Kinzō
catalogue_raissonne: Ukiyo-e shūka 14 (1981), Hiroshige list, p. 249, ōban #65.8
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Banri ni hito minami ni saru/ Sanshun ni kari kita ni tobu (My friend is leaving for the south ten thousand miles away./ Geese are heading north for the whole spring months through.)

Haku Kyoi (Bo Juyi 772-846), not written on the print

from Wakanrōeishū vol.1, Autumn

*Part of a famous farewell poem followed by a well-known phrase:
\"I don\'t know how many years they(geese) will be gone. They, as well as my friend, may not be able to come back.\"

Dr. N. Hayashi, Oct. 2007
markings: Censor: Kiwame 極; publisher\'s seal: Jōkin (Jōshūya Kinzō)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Anthology of Japanese and Chinese Poems for Recitation (Wakan rōei-shū 和漢朗詠集)
title: Flying Geese and Full Moon
